p.k: Brazilian artist Gilberto Gil returns to Jazz a Vienne with music inspired by his latest album 'Fé na Festa': a mixture of celebration, tradition and even some rock. Although his new sound has its roots in Brazilian culture, it is always inspired by jazz.
p.d: Brazilian artist Gilberto Gil returns to Jazz a Vienne in France with a new round of singing that is inspired by his latest album 'Fé na Festa': a mixture of celebration, tradition and even some rock now and then. Gilberto Gil, worldwide known for as musician and the Brazilian minister of Culture, was one of the pioneers of the cultural movement 'tropicalismo'. This movement, with a strong character of social protest, combines elements of traditional Brazilian culture with modern art forms. Gilberto Gil's new sound clearly has its roots in Brazilian culture, yet it is always inspired by jazz.
